title: How to Overcome Weakness of the Heart? | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 2.3 | 17.08.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: we become in touch with Krishna by chanting his name Hare Krishna that is the beginning of our connection with Krishna
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains how Krishna induces Arjuna to fight and emphasizes the importance of chanting Hare Krishna as the beginning of our connection with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: simply chanting that will help also it will take time but if we avoid the offenses then it will be very quickly purified
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada elaborates on Krishna's name, form, and activities, highlighting the importance of avoiding offenses while chanting to accelerate purification.

segments.key_quote: whatever he is doing is God is good he is all good we should have to do it whatever he is doing there is all good
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses how ordinary people misunderstand Krishna's behavior and stresses the importance of following the orders of higher authorities rather than imitating them, emphasizing that everything Krishna does is perfect.

segments.key_quote: your business is to chastise the mischief mongers that is your business you cannot excuse the mischief monger
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that those without transcendental vision misunderstand Krishna and discusses the duty of a Kshatriya to chastise mischief-mongers, advocating for strict capital punishment.

segments.key_quote: one has to discharge the duty ordered by the superior authority very strictly without any consideration
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada equates excessive sympathy with weakness of heart, emphasizing the need to follow the orders of superior authorities strictly and develop special senses to perceive the soul.

segments.key_quote: anyone who has become competent to control the tongue to control the mind to control the anger to control the belly and control the genital if six kind of control is there, he is fit for becoming spiritual master
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes the importance of controlling the tongue and other senses to become a qualified spiritual master.

segments.key_quote: You chant Hare Kṛṣṇa, always glorify बाचांशि वैकुन्ठ कुनानु वर्णने. बाचांशि, means talking. Talking is the business of tongue.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains how to engage the tongue in the service of the Lord by chanting Hare Krishna and avoiding nonsense talk and sense gratification.

segments.key_quote: Krishna said to the gopis that you have to be satisfied with your own business I cannot return you anything for your love
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada describes the pure devotion of the gopis and Krishna's inability to repay their love.

segments.key_quote: You Have To See Kṛṣṇa With Separate Eyes.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that one must see Krishna with separate eyes and that understanding Krishna's transcendental activities leads to immediate liberation.

segments.key_quote: for a devotee, this शाजुज्य मुक्ति is just like hell
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses different types of liberation, including merging into the Brahman existence, and contrasts them with the devotee's perspective, who considers such merging as hellish.

segments.key_quote: the senses are just like serpents
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada compares heavenly promotion to an imaginary flower and likens the senses to serpents, emphasizing the dangers they pose.

segments.key_quote: the whole aim was how to go back to home back to God not sense gratification
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the dangers of illicit sex and the strictness of Vedic civilization, emphasizing the aim of human life as going back to Godhead, and the importance of following varnashrama dharma.

segments.key_quote: a Brahmana must act as a Brahmana a Kshatriya must as here he said that is Krishna said you are Kshatriya you are why you are talking of this rascal
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada elaborates on the duties of different varnas (Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya) and the importance of following the rules and regulations of each, emphasizing the government's duty to inspect and maintain varnashrama dharma.

segments.key_quote: Kṛṣṇa wants to adjoin that why you are indulging in this weakness of mind you are under my protection I am ordering you to fight why you are denying you this is the part
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that in Kali Yuga, everything is topsy-turvy, and emphasizes the importance of chanting Hare Krishna, controlling the senses through bhakti, and surrendering to Krishna's protection.
